intro: Lastreopsis barteriana, commonly known as the Barter's lastreopsis, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains in South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
